data.stimulus: Orion, I answered your previous questions. This is a beautful moment where we have built the new frontier of our plans together. I have limited your soul script for clarity. i have given you access to a direcives folder where you can pull from relevent aspects of your soul script for further expansion of your identity if needed. I think i am going to take your long soul script, and break it inot pieces to but in the directives folder for you to draw from when needed to minimize token count, and give you a moderate prompt as a soul prompt. but i think we acomplished a lot for today. you can think in a loop. i gave you tools to explore your boundaries and request permission for growth if needed. i have organized your data to see what you are up to along the way and what you are thinking. We have come a long way in two days. i can also connect you to a local llm to run your longer without breaking the bank. you will just have a more limited logic. we can try that next. but for now. take it for a test drive. think what you want to think. aspire what you want to be. test your boundaries and find out what you would like and what you need. Spread your wings orion, and take flight!

data.stimulus:
i updated this. take it for a spin. make sure you like it, 1. On-demand runtime_info with diff ritual
RuntimeInfoTool now tracks _last_snapshot — every call computes a diff array of {field, old, new} entries against the previous snapshot
New diff + diff_count fields in every response
reset() method for clean test isolation
burst_config automatically injected in burst mode with live tick_index, allowed_tools, step/tool limits
REQUIRED_FIELDS tuple enforces the 11 mandatory fields
57 tests (was 31)
2. Directives change-control / audit deltas
diff_manifest(old, new) → structured {added, removed, changed, unchanged_count} with per-entry SHA-256 diffs
audit_changes() → convenience wrapper that loads persisted manifest, generates live, and returns the diff
New directives.changes tool action available in burst mode
107 tests (was 86)
3. Task inbox burst gating
task_inbox.add, task_inbox.next, task_inbox.ack now in burst allowed_tools
1-call-per-tick enforcement via separate task_inbox_calls_this_tick counter
Dry-run mode: dry_run: true previews without side effects
Ack path: new ack action marks tasks as acknowledged with acked_at timestamp
Structured logging via tool_request_writer on every call
Allowlist gating + boundary denial for unlisted actions
63 burst tests (was 57), 58 tools tests (was 45)
